programmes.show_description: Matthew Schrier is kidnapped in Syria by Al Qaeda, but when the opportunity to escape arises, will he save himself or stay with his fellow American prisoner?
Teenager Simone Blignaut is in Bolivia to secure a major cocaine deal when she's double-crossed - now she must evade capture.
Journalist Phil Cox is investigating allegations of illegally deployed chemical weapons when he's taken hostage.

Near the junction to East Midlands airport, a trailer sheds its load and causes rush hour chaos. Adam dispatches a crack team of his finest recovery ops.
A 20-tonne digger has been written off after it fell into the Thames. Rory is dispatched to rescue a Sprinter which is blocking a bus lane.
Reality series. With Todd and his rival Darrell on the same route, will they manage to keep things professional? Polar boss Mark throws a newbie in at the deep end.
Reality series. Ice road rookie Mike attempts his first solo delivery; Polar's top dog Todd Dewey runs into trouble and truck problems slow Art's season to a halt.
Reality series. The consequences are huge when Darrell's truck breaks down. Plus, Mike Simmons' inexperience costs him on tough winter roads.
Reality series. Art struggles to negotiate a melting ice crossing, Alex faces a mud-covered mountain, and Lisa and Darrell put their company's future on the line.
Reality series. Todd must think outside the box, Alex races against the clock, and just getting home proves a struggle for Darrell and Lisa.

programmes.show_name: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
programmes.show_description: Four men hijack a New York subway car, taking the passengers hostage and demanding £1m dollars. Thriller starring Walter Matthau and Robert Shaw. (1974)
Clayton's Towing tackles a devastating 80-tonne crane collapse, Wagga Towing recovers a rolled B-double, and Parks Towing attend to a stolen car recovery in boulder-ridden Port Hills. (Ep6)
Park's Towing salvage a rolled concrete truck, Tow Boss Scott removes a car from a popular beach, and Clayton's Towing remove an upturned dive boat at Queensland's Tin Can Bay. (Ep7)
Park's Towing race to recover five cars dumped down a steep ravine. Clayton's Towing recover a stranded yacht, and North Coast Towing try to dislodge a bogged tipper before it rolls over. (Ep8)
Truckworks clear a burnt-out B-Double. Wagga Towing head to a rural farm property to salvage a burnt-out Steiger and Clayton's Towing recover a P3-Orion for the Queensland Air Museum. (Ep9/9)
Tempers flare as Parks Towing takes on a high-pressure truck recovery from the bottom of a steep gully in the snowy mountains of Canterbury, New Zealand.

In North Yorkshire, cops look out for criminals and illegal drivers moving around under the cover of darkness. After a spike in catalytic converter thefts, a stinger is used.
Ron and Spence race to a scene of an alleged knife attack.
A suspected drug dealer crashes his bike into a hedge in a bid to escape. A man wanted for ABH is caught hiding in a bathroom.

Couple Aaron and Becky enlist Kings Heavy Haulage for their literal house move. Their tiny home is set to move from rural Pembrokeshire to its new location near to Wolverhampton.
The cops deal with a major drugs bust, a man linked to an alleged assault on a woman, and a gang of suspected poachers with an un-taxed van.
The pursuit of a white van tearing up the turf proves to be a family affair, and a two-year-old German shepherd cross named Titan earns his spurs.
Officers race to catch a reckless joyrider who refuses to stop. As the cops close in, the suspects run for it after crashing the car and it bursts into flames.
Dog handler Darren calls on all his powers of persuasion to try and end a rooftop stand-off, and Steve is forced to use his pepper spray on a suspect.
A vicious blizzard on British Columbia's Coquihalla Highway shuts down the road as Adam battles a multi-vehicle pile-up. Meanwhile Jamie tries to free a semi from a steep, icy off-ramp.
A woman's car is stolen at knifepoint and police mobilize to find her vehicle and the perpetrator; police break down the door of a woman who has failed to appear for her hearing.
U.S. Naval Officer Lemar Burton is arrested with five kilos of cocaine through the Bogota airport. Now he must survive one of Colombia's most brutal prisons.
